_A_SWITCH_COMPONENT_DESCRIPTION_: The ASwitch component is a switch with support for various states that can be bound to a data model. The component supports both two-state and three-state modes, as well as the display of custom labels.
_A_SWITCH_GROUP_THREE_STATE_DESCRIPTION_: This example demonstrates how to use a switch in three-state mode using is-three-state, default-value, and default-label. When the switch is in an intermediate state, the model value is set to default-value (in this case, null), and the label Default is displayed. This mode allows the switch to have three states: true, false, and a default state.
_A_SWITCH_GROUP_TITLE_DESCRIPTION_: This example demonstrates how to use title and is-title-html properties in the switch component. In the first switch, the tooltip is displayed with HTML interpretation, as is-title-html is set to true. In the second example, the HTML code in the tooltip is not interpreted because is-title-html is set to false. Both switches display a tooltip with the text Aloha on hover.
_A_SWITCH_GROUP_TRUE_FALSE_LABEL_DESCRIP: This example demonstrates how to use true-label and false-label to set the displayed labels of the switch. When the model value corresponds to the true state, the switch displays the label 1, and when in the false state, it displays the label 0.
_A_SWITCH_GROUP_TRUE_FALSE_VALUE_DESCRIP: This example demonstrates how to use true-value and false-value to set the values assigned to the model when switching. When the switch is in the true state, the model value becomes '1'. In the false state, the model value becomes '0'.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_DEFAULT_LABEL_DESCRIPTIO: If the model value does not match falseValue and trueValue, this label is displayed.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_DEFAULT_VALUE_DESCRIPTIO: Used only when isThreeState is set to true, for representing the third state of the model.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_FALSE_LABEL_DESCRIPTION_: The label displayed when the switch is in the false state.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_FALSE_VALUE_DESCRIPTION_: The value assigned to the model when the switch is in the false state.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_FULL_WIDTH_DESCRIPTION_: If set to true, the switch takes up the full available width.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_IS_THREE_STATE_DESCRIPTI: Used for a three-state switch: trueValue, falseValue, and defaultValue.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_TRUE_LABEL_DESCRIPTION_: The label displayed when the switch is in the true state.
_A_SWITCH_PROPS_TRUE_VALUE_DESCRIPTION_: The value assigned to the model when the switch is in the true state.
